00015 def show_tree(obj,d=0):
00016     """Handy function for displaying a tree of graph objects"""
00017     print "%s%s" % ("-"*d,obj.__class__.__name__)
00018     if 'get_children' in dir(obj):
00019         for a in obj.get_children(): show_tree(a,d+1)

00021 class Plotter(QtGui.QWidget):
00022     """Plotter for matplotlib wrapped in a qt widget
00023 
00024     All plotter rendering will consist of the following steps:
00025 
00026        plot.clear()
00027        plot.properties()
00028        plot.points()/plot.curve()/...
00029        plot.render()
00030     """
00031     
00032     def __init__(self,parent,size=None):
00033         """
00034         Define the plotting panel for the graph.
00035         
00036         TODO: Make this a panel in the AUI widget, with a different panel
00037         TODO: for each graph type.  That way the caller does not need to
00038         TODO: worry about the commensurate axes when they are asking for
00039         TODO: data to be plotted.
00040         """
00041         QtGui.QDialog.__init__(self)
00042         #wx.Panel.__init__(self, parent=parent, id=-1)
00043 
00044         # Set up the user interface from Designer.
00045         #self.ui = Ui_ImageDialog()
00046         #self.ui.setupUi(self)
00047         
00048         
00049 
00050         # Add the plot widget
00051         self._add_plot_widget_add_plot_widget()
00052 
00053         # Define some constants
00054         self.colorlistcolorlist = ['b','g','r','c','m','y']
00055         self.symbollistsymbollist = ['o','x','^','v','<','>','+','s','d','D','h','H','p']

00057     def _add_plot_widget(self):
00058         """
00059         Add the plotting widget to the panel
00060         """
00061         # Put a figure on the panel, add some axes and put it on a canvas
00062         self.figurefigure = Figure()
00063         self.axesaxes   = self.figurefigure.add_subplot(111)
00064         self.canvascanvas = FigureCanvas(self,-1,self.figurefigure)
00065 
00066         # Create the toolbar
00067         self.toolbartoolbar = Toolbar(self.canvascanvas)
00068         self.toolbartoolbar.Realize()
00069 
00070         # On Windows, default frame size behaviour is incorrect
00071         # you don't need this under Linux
00072 #        if False:
00073 #            tw, th = self.toolbar.GetSizeTuple()
00074 #            fw, fh = self.canvas.GetSizeTuple()
00075 #            self.toolbar.SetSize(wx.Size(fw, th))
00076 
00077         # Layout the window
00078 #        sizer = wx.BoxSizer(wx.VERTICAL)
00079 #        sizer.Add(self.canvas, 1, wx.LEFT|wx.TOP|wx.GROW)
00080 #        sizer.Add(self.toolbar, 0, wx.LEFT | wx.EXPAND)
00081 #        self.SetSizer(sizer)

00083     def properties(self,prop):
00084         """Set some properties of the graph.
00085         
00086         The set of properties is not yet determined.
00087         """
00088         # The particulars of how they are stored and manipulated (e.g., do 
00089         # we want an inventory internally) is not settled.  I've used a
00090         # property dictionary for now.
00091         #
00092         # How these properties interact with a user defined style file is
00093         # even less clear.
00094 
00095         # Properties defined by plot
00096         self.axesaxes.set_xlabel(prop["xlabel"])
00097         self.axesaxes.set_ylabel(prop["ylabel"])
00098         self.axesaxes.set_title(prop["title"])
00099 
00100         # Properties defined by user
00101         self.axesaxes.grid(True)
00102 
00103     def clear(self):
00104         """Reset the plot"""
00105         
00106         # TODO: Redraw is brutal.  Render to a backing store and swap in
00107         # TODO: rather than redrawing on the fly.
00108         self.axesaxes.clear()
00109         self.axesaxes.hold(True)
00110 
00111     def render(self):
00112         """Commit the plot after all objects are drawn"""
00113         # TODO: this is when the backing store should be swapped in.
00114         self.axesaxes.legend()
00115         pass
00116 
00117     def xaxis(self,label,units):
00118         """xaxis label and units.
00119         
00120         Axis labels know about units.
00121         
00122         We need to do this so that we can detect when axes are not
00123         commesurate.  Currently this is ignored other than for formatting
00124         purposes.
00125         """
00126         if units != "": label = label + " (" + units + ")"
00127         self.axesaxes.set_xlabel(label)
00128         pass
00129     
00130     def yaxis(self,label,units):
00131         """yaxis label and units."""
00132         if units != "": label = label + " (" + units + ")"
00133         self.axesaxes.set_ylabel(label)
00134         pass
00135 
00136     def _connect_to_xlim(self,callback):
00137         """Bind the xlim change notification to the callback"""
00138         def process_xlim(axes):
00139             lo,hi = axes.get_xlim()
00140             callback(lo,hi)
00141         self.axesaxes.callbacks.connect('xlim_changed',process_xlim)
00142     
00143     def connect(self,trigger,callback):
00144         if trigger == 'xlim': self._connect_to_xlim_connect_to_xlim(callback)
00145 
00146     def points(self,x,y,dx=None,dy=None,color=0,symbol=0,label=None):
00147         """Draw markers with error bars"""
00148         # Convert tuple (lo,hi) to array [(x-lo),(hi-x)]
00149         if dx != None and type(dx) == type(()):
00150             dx = nx.vstack((x-dx[0],dx[1]-x)).transpose()
00151         if dy != None and type(dy) == type(()):
00152             dy = nx.vstack((y-dy[0],dy[1]-y)).transpose()
00153 
00154         if True or dx is None and dy is None:
00155             h = self.axesaxes.plot(x,y,color=self._color_color(color),
00156                                    marker=self._symbol_symbol(symbol))
00157         else:
00158             h,hcap,hbar = self.axesaxes.errorbar(x,y,dy,color=self._color_color(color),
00159                                              marker=self._symbol_symbol(symbol), 
00160                                              linestyle='None',
00161                                              label=label,picker=5)
00162 
00163     def curve(self,x,y,dy=None,color=0,symbol=0,label=None):
00164         """Draw a line on a graph, possibly with confidence intervals."""
00165         c = self._color_color(color)
00166         hlist = self.axesaxes.plot(x,y,color=c,marker='',linestyle='-',label=label)
00167         if False and dy != None:
00168             if type(dy) == type(()):
00169                 self.axesaxes.plot(x,dy[0],color=c,
00170                                marker='',linestyle='--',label='_nolegend_')
00171                 self.axesaxes.plot(x,dy[1],color=c,
00172                                marker='',linestyle='--',label='_nolegend_')
00173             else:
00174                 self.axesaxes.plot(x,y+dy,color=c,
00175                                marker='',linestyle='--',label='_nolegend_')
00176                 self.axesaxes.plot(x,y-dy,color=c,
00177                                marker='',linestyle='--',label='_nolegend_')
00178 
00179     def _color(self,c):
00180         """Return a particular colour"""
00181         return self.colorlistcolorlist[c%len(self.colorlistcolorlist)]
00182 
00183     def _symbol(self,s):
00184         """Return a particular symbol"""
00185         return self.symbollistsymbollist[s%len(self.symbollistsymbollist)]
